intro: Calycothrix glabra var. virgata, commonly known as the smooth calycothrix, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats.
